Topic.Title: Bernanke warns Ron Paul's Fed audit bill could cause 'nightmare scenario' --------- stablishing a system in which the Fed's monetary policy moves could be immediately called into question by lawmakers would have a "chilling effect" on the institution and generally reduce its ability to help steer the economy, he warned.

Message.Msg: miguelsicluna: "It is just a private institution that does the will of mostly foreign banksters. Foreign banksters should never have been given control over US monetary policy. It must end." You serious, really? Did you graduate from Fox News University? Unreal!! "...The Federal Reserve is considered an independent central bank. It is independent since its decisions do not have to be ratified by the President or Congress. The Federal Reserve System was created by Congress in 1913 "to provide for the establishment of Federal reserve banks, to furnish an elastic currency, to afford means of rediscounting commercial paper, to establish a more effective supervision of banking in the United States, and for other purposes." While the Federal Reserve is an independent institution, it is still accountable to Congress. The Constitution gives Congress the power to coin money and set its value. Congress delegated this power to the Federal Reserve in the 1913 Federal Reserve Act, but still maintains oversight authority. Under the Humphrey-Hawkins Act of 1978, the Federal Reserve must submit a report on the economy to Congress by February 20 and July 20 of each year. Alan Greenspan, the current Chairman of the Federal Reserve Board of Governors, is called to testify on the report before Senate and House Committees. The Federal Reserve System is made up of a Board of Governors and twelve regional Federal Reserve Banks located in major cities throughout the country. There are seven members that sit on the Board of Governors. Each member must be nominated by the President of the United States and confirmed by the Senate. Members are appointed to serve 14-year nonrenewable terms. The President also nominates members of the Board to serve as Chair and Vice Chair for four-year renewable terms. These appointments must also be confirmed by the Senate..."

Message.Title: jurors given free ipads for deliberation?
Message.Msg: “The physical devices you received are evidence in this trial,” said U.S. District Court Judge Lucy Koh as she read instructions to the jury. “You may use them in your deliberations, and may connect to the Internet through the Web browser application, but must not alter or modify the devices in any way.” Koh said jurors are not allowed to insert SIM cards into the devices, if included with the packaging, but may connect to the court’s Wi-Fi network to access the Internet. “Once connected, you must decline any software update notifications that may be presented to you. You also must not download any content, such as apps, music, photographs, or games, to the devices,” said Koh."

Message.Title: Does anyone know how to value a stock?
Message.Msg: the stock price is supposed to be a reflection of the future cash flows. You have to be an idiot to think that Apple is overpriced. It has been manipulated for the past 2 years because people are making a boat load of money sending the price down and letting it ride back up. Apple's future (2013) earning are approx $53 next year (that's before revisions from iphone 5 and ipad mini), which is a 19% growth rate, and at the current price is a PE of 12.3. Compare that to the S&P, with 2013 earnings of $119 at a growth rate of 12.9%, you get a PE multiple of 12. That's a PEG of about 1, so giving apple a peg of 1 you end up with a price of $1013. These calcs do not even consider Apple's cash hoard, which is probably 6-10 times as large as tghe average cash hoard of stocks in the S&P. Not including the delta in cash hoard provieds a nice safety margin, which is why aapl's price targets should be north of $1000 (i.e. like Topeka's target). There is no logical reason to say that aapl shouldn't go higher from here - well, with the exception of people trying to scare you out of your shares so they can make some $$ on a short drop. Is it logical to say that apple is priced to perfection with a pe of 12.3 and a peg of 0.6...ABSOLUTELY NO! is it logical to say that a company that has been executing so well is going to have a major misstep (and i mean major, it would have to be major to really hurt this company in the long run)...ABSOLUTELY NO! Is it logical to not account for the huge cash hoard compared to ANY other company on the planet...ABSOLUTELY NO! Oh, and lets not forget about a dividend that has huge upside potential...is it logical to not account for this...ABSOLUTELY NO! Buy and hold people...stick with Apple, stick with Crackus.

Message.Title: If you are not really a trader but are wondering why AAPL dropped yesterday and what is in store
Message.Msg: This is oversimplified but basically true: The fundamentals and performance of a company determine the long-term destination of a stock. Institutional trading determines the path it takes to get there. The term institution is broad—hedge funds, retirement funds, mutual funds, banks, brokers, very wealthy traders, HFTs on and on. Almost all institutions trade using computer algorithms—quants. These quants (institutions) can be divided up into two basic categories: Analytical and Statistical (HFTs)—the latter is what most people think of when you say quants. There is of course some overlap between these two categories. Analytical algorithms running on super systems analyze ungodly amounts of information at ungodly speeds—fundamental, technical on and on and even news. Trades are placed accordingly. Statistical algorithms running on super computers located as close to the exchanges as possible to minimize latency analyze price action and trade accordingly—at an ungodly rate. They provide enormous liquidity and sometimes contribute to volatility. Institutional size volume is what moves the price…not to be confused with a high or low volume day. Minute to minute, every day, institutional size trades move the price. To simplify even further—when certain technical levels are reached (in an uptrend for example), quants and savvy institutional traders respond by taking profits. There doesn`t have to be anything “wrong” as in bad news, though there might be. An extreme technical level in and of itself is enough to send the stock tumbling. If you want a simplified version of what this looks like concerning AAPL and how predictable or not it is, do this: Bring up a daily candlestick chart on your computer running over a 2 yr. period. Add a 22 day exponential moving average (22EMA). Next add an envelope—22 day with a variance (standard deviation) of 5. This envelope simply runs parallel above and below the moving average—I call it 22EMA/5SD. You will notice that the 22EMA roughly tracks the meat of the price action and that 90-95% of the price action is contained within the 5SD envelope. You could say that AAPL normally runs in this “channel” and when it goes too far in either extreme it always “corrects.” Go back 2 years and check each time it broke the 5SD envelope on the high side. But stop as you come up to 2012, because the beginning of AAPL`s recent famous parabolic run is an exception—so wait on that. Now add a 7SD envelope and see how often it has gotten breached in the last two years, stopping again at the beginning of 2012. Finally add a 9SD and then an 11SD. In the end, you will notice that the technical warning signals usually go off (correction, immediate or shortly thereafter) for AAPL when it breaches the 5SD, and almost always go off when it breaches the 7SD. If you then look at AAPL`s parabolic run that ended April 10 2012, you will see that when APPL goes parabolic it trades mostly between the upper 5-11SD! For the past 3 months AAPL has demonstrated fairly typical uptrend behavior—staying mostly in the channel defined by 22EMA/5SD. Monday the 7SD was touched. Yesterday it was broken above. Now the question remains if it will correct as it normally does or if it will continue parabolic for a while. In short, yesterday`s drop was probably more technical than news driven. If corrections are in order they will test the obvious support levels one at a time until the bull and bear machines and men and women think the price is low enough. But that`s another topic.

App developers and corporations such as Bayerische Motoren Werke AG (BMW) and Shanghai General Motors Co. (GM) are turning to Google’s AdMob unit to reach Chinese smartphone users on the go. Google’s strength in mobile ads stands in contrast to its search-engine business in China. The global leader has failed to catch homegrown favorite Baidu Inc. (BIDU) in computer-based search, and two years ago Google moved its search servers out of the mainland in a censorship dispute with the government. “Since 2010, Google has been trying many things to keep its presence in China,” said Steven Chang, chief executive officer of ZenithOptimedia’s China division, which buys advertising from Google and Baidu. “AdMob now has quite a significant share of the market.” Thousands of Developers AdMob says it has more than 10,000 registered developers in China. The unit, which Google acquired for $750 million in 2010, says its servers get 7.9 billion requests a month to show ads to mobile-app users in the country. China will overtake the U.S. as the world’s largest smartphone market this year, with shipments climbing 52 percent to 137 million, according to market researcher IDC. AdMob’s key advantage is its reach across smartphone technologies, covering iPhones and iPads as well as Android devices, said Chen Haozhi, chief executive officer of Chukong Co., a maker of mobile Bloomberg news

Message.Title: AT&T/Verizon Take Note: China Telecom Boosted By iPhone 4S Despite Subsidies
Message.Msg: CHINA TELECOM CREDITS SUBSCRIBER GAINS TO IPHONE 4S LAUNCH (By Sam Oliver Wednesday, August 22, 2012)........... ............China Telecom announced this week that it added 8.35 million users during its second quarter, an increase credited mostly to the launch of the iPhone 4S..........China Telecom said Wednesday that its net income for the second quarter was 4.55 billion yuan, or $716 million, beating analyst expectations of 4.4 billion yuan, according to Bloomberg. China Telecom began offering the iPhone 4S on March 9, ending China Unicom's exclusive claim to Apple's smartphone in mainland China......... Because of the popularity of the iPhone and its subsidy costs, China Telecom expects to see "short-term pressure" on its profit margins, but has also projected long-term growth as subscribers come to the carrier because of Apple's iPhone. .........Though China Telecom's subsidy costs increased during the quarter because of the iPhone 4S launch, the effect was not as great as most expected it would be. China Telecom also saw its average revenue per user increase thanks to the iPhone 4S launch. China Telecom has been aggressive with the iPhone 4S, offering the handset to customers fully subsidized in exchange for a two-year contract starting at $62, or a three-year contract for $46 per month. .........With China Telecom and China Unicom seeing strong results from the iPhone, the nation's largest wireless carrier, China Mobile, remains on the outside. Market watchers have predicted that Apple's next iPhone will offer support for China Mobile, which has more than 650 million total subscribers. However, rumors of an Apple-China Mobile deal have persisted for years with no change..........The nation of China has become an intense focus for Apple in recent years, and its interest in the country has paid off with significant growth. Apple will enhance support for Chinese-language users later this year with iOS 6, which will add support for Mandarin and Cantonese to Siri, as well as easier Chinese character input and integration with popular Internet services like Baidu, Sina Weibo, Youku and Tudou.

Message.Msg: Interesting thank you. At this point, a September iPhone launch seems all but certain — after all, it’s been nearly a year since Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) released the last iteration of its top-selling smartphone, and tech blogs and insider sources have been churning out rumors since March, with the information becoming more credible and more specific as time progressed. TechCrunch received a tip from a Verizon employee informing them of the blackout on September 21, which was already the rumored launch date of the new iPhone. The announcement for the next iPhone is expected to happen on September 12, when Apple is rumored to be holding a “special event.”

Message.Msg: Rep. Paul Ryan Tuesday brushed off negative attacks from the Obama campaign, saying he isn't "worried at all" because the November election will come down to "a referendum on the president's failed leadership." In an interview with Fox News' Sean Hannity, the Republican vice presidential nominee said he believes the country will see through the Obama campaign's strategy of "attack and blame" because voters "want real leadership." "They want us to get this country on the right track. So, yes, it's a referendum on the president's failed leadership," Ryan said, adding that Obama can't compete with "the positive vision" offered by Mitt Romney's campaign for the presidency.

Message.Title: D'Souza's '2016' Unearths Obama's Rage
Message.Msg: By Thomas Sowell Years, and sometimes decades, pass between my visits to movie theaters. But I drove 30 miles to see the movie "2016," based on Dinesh D'Souza's best-selling book "The Roots of Obama's Rage." Where I live is so politically correct that such a movie would not even be mentioned, much less shown. Every seat in the theater was filled, even though there had been an earlier showing that day, and more showings were scheduled for the rest of the afternoon and evening. I had to sit on a staircase in the balcony, but it was worth it. The audience was riveted. You could barely hear a sound from them, or detect a movement, and certainly not smell popcorn. Yet the movie had no bombast, no violence, no sex, and no spectacular visual effects. The documentary itself was fascinating, as Dinesh D'Souza presented the story of Barack Obama's life and view of the world, in a very conversational sort of way, illustrating it with visits to people and places around the world that played a role in the way Obama's ideas and beliefs evolved. It was refreshing to see how addressing adults as adults could be effective, in an age when so many parts of the media address the public as if they were children who need a constant whirlwind of sounds and movements to keep them interested. Dinesh D'Souza's own perspective, as someone born in India who came to America and became an American, provided a special insight into the way people from the Third World often perceive or misperceive the United States and the Western world. That Third World perspective is Obama's perspective, D'Souza demonstrates in this documentary, as in his book — and it is a perspective that is very foreign to that of most Americans, which may be why some believe that Obama was born elsewhere. D'Souza is convinced that the president was born in Hawaii, as he claims, but argues that not only Obama's time living in Indonesia and his emotionally charged visits to his father's home in Africa, have had a deep and impassioned effect on his thinking. The story of Barack Obama, however, is not just the story of how one man came to be the way he is. It is a much larger story about how millions of Americans came to vote for, and some to idolize, a man whose fundamental beliefs and values are so different from their own. Obama's own ideological view of the world. What is that ideological view? The Third World, or anti-colonial, view is that the rich nations have gotten rich by taking wealth from the poor nations. It is part of a much larger vision, in which the rich in general have gotten rich by taking from the poor, whether in their own country or elsewhere. Whatever its factual weaknesses, it is an emotionally powerful vision, to which many people have dedicated their lives, and for which some have even risked their lives. Some of these people appear in this documentary movie, as they have appeared throughout the formative phases of Barack Obama's life. The Rev. Jeremiah Wright is just the most visible and vocal of a long line of such people who played crucial roles in Obama's evolution. When Jeremiah Wright thundered about how "white folks' greed runs a world in need," he captured the essence of the Third World or anti-colonial vision. But many of the other mentors, allies, family, and friends of Barack Obama over the years were of the same mindset, as this documentary demonstrates. More important, the film "2016" demonstrates how so many of Obama's actions as president of the United States, which D'Souza had predicted on the basis of his study of Obama's background, are perfectly consistent with that ideology.

Message.Title: Romney pulling ahead in the polls
Message.Msg: There have got to be some very frustrated campaign staffers working for Team Obama. All this work, months of negative campaigning, millions of dollars in spending and for what? The race is still at a statistical tie. Here's the latest polling: Gallup's daily tracker has it Romney at 47%, Obama at 45% Rasmussen's daily poll has it Romney at 45%, Obama at 44%. This has got to be massively disheartening for the President's campaign, which is already spending more money than it is raising. Meanwhile, Romney's campaign is coasting without much spending because it is legally prohibited from unleashing its general election funds until after Romney is formally nominated at the GOP convention. There is a bright spot for Team Obama: the most recent NBC/WSJ poll found the President ahead of Romney by four points nationally. But, of course, to believe that poll you'd also have to believe that Democratic turnout will be almost as good as the record turnout in 2008. That's unlikely and, since the NBC/WSJ poll is very much an outlier, you'd have to be pretty desperate to think that the President is actually ahead of Romney now.

Message.Title: Romney Takes the Lead in Wisconsin
Message.Msg: Mitt Romney has turned the corner in the crucial battleground state of Wisconsin, opening up a one-point lead in the Badger State, according to a new poll. The Public Policy Polling shows the Republican presidential nominee leading President Barack Obama 48 percent to 47 percent, the Washington Times reported, which match the numbers from a Rasmussen Reports poll released last week. Obama beat Sen. John McCain of Arizona in Wisconsin by 14 percentage points in 2008. The president has led in Wisconsin polls but that lead has slipped since Romney announced Wisconsin congressman Paul Ryan as his running mate. Wisconsin independents are abandoning Obama, who has seen his lead among them shrink from 14 points last month to four now.

Message.Title: DAY to DAY variation in AAPL share price
Message.Msg: No big news, and we are up one day, down the next, by 1.5% each day, seems like big movements. It has to be by someone doing large enough transactions to move the AAPL needle a lot. Intentional or not, it all averages out, so day to day movements are really not key to investing in this stock, unless you are a "minute trader" or "hour trader" or "day trader". And daytrader professionals don't post on boards like this, only small retail daytraders. And the GREAT majority of small retail daytraders lose money. So.....all the folks commenting on this board on movements of less than several days duration, must be losers. So...most of the posts on this board are useless.

Topic.Title: 15-20 Dollar Swings Daily. Traders making a fortune.

Message.Msg: Yes, trick is not to get greedy. If you have a 20%, 30% or 40% return cash out and wait. I made a 41% return on my naked Calls, sold early when the stock was at $569 then waited until today to re-enter at $659. If you have an up day on high volume that means buyers are willing to pay more for each share sold. I like to quit while I'm up, wait a few days to feel the trend, then reinvest or not. RSI is key with AAPL. The minute it goes below 65 sell. When the stock dumps, which it always does look to re-enter when the RSI is around 30-35. Follow this simple principle and you will make big bucks. I personally love the price swings. It like having a stock that reports earnings every two months.

Topic.Title: Apple is the biggest gamble stock of our times...

Message.Msg: Maybe learning to do valuation would help? It has been way undervalued for the last 4+ years. Its in a better financial position now than it was 4 years ago when the price was $80/shr. The biggest thing holding apple back is the misconception that it is "expensive." Look at the PEG ratio. It measures the PE in relation to EPS growth. It is amazingly low. True Peg is under .3. Fair value equals 1. So the stock is technically 70% undervalued. I doubt it will ever hit a PE of 70, but let's say one day people finally realize its value and the PE climbs to 25. Based on today's EPS of around $43, you have a stock price of $1075. If it hits EPS 2013 of $60/shr, which many see as possible and it trades at a PE of 20 you get $1200/shr. This PE is so low for the growth and we aren't even factoring in the 100bill of cash on hand. WHY where you shorting this stock?

Topic.Title: Head and Shoulders Forming...

Message.Msg: Even if I believed in such patterns (I don't) I would point out that one half of a head and shoulders pattern is neither rate nor meaningful. All it means is that a peak has occured that's higher than the preceding peak, something that happens frequently for a growing stock unless it only goes straight up (nonexistent). So every up trending stock reveals numerous "left half head and shoulders). Does that mean they all complete the pattern and then collapse? Apparently not. Thompson

Message.Msg: IMPORTANT READ -- Learn the facts -- When a company LIES like this -- Then, do YOU really want to invest your honest money into a LYING CHEAT COMPANY like Samsung?.... no wonder the Samsung share price is dropping. Sooner or later, the TRUTH rises to the surface. And, the truth has risen to the surface via publicly disclosed court documents. READ THIS.... From Fortune Article.... Apple sold 5.7 million iPads in the U.S. last quarter, court docs show. Samsung sold 37,000 Tabs By Philip Elmer-DeWitt August 10, 2012: 8:02 AM ET Reports of Galaxy Tab sales, like Mark Twain's death, have been greatly exaggerated FORTUNE -- In early December 2010, dozens of reporters happily repeated Samsung's claim that it had sold 1 million Galaxy Tab computers in the three and a half weeks since the tablet's November 2010 U.S. debut. Seven weeks later Samsung was telling analysts that Tab sales had passed 2 million. It's hard to reconcile those numbers with court documents Samsung filed Thursday in a California federal court that show the company selling 262,000 Galaxy Tabs in the U.S. -- the world's largest tablet market -- in Q4 2010 and 77,000 in Q1 2011. The discrepancy in the estimates of independent market researchers is even greater. According to an IDC press release issued just last week, Samsung sold 2,391,000 tablet computers worldwide in Q2 2012, up 117.6% from the same quarter last year. According to Samsung's court filing, it sold a total of 37,000 "accused" tablets (see UPDATE) in the U.S. last quarter, down 86% year over year.

Topic.Title: Head and Shoulders Forming...

Message.Msg: Maybe but for that matter you could also say that we are seeing the breakout of an extended reverse head and shoulders 636 530 622 (630 neckline) that tried first to fail (earnings) and is now breaking out in a quasi-parabolic measured move up to 630 + (630-530) = 730. Not saying that this will necessarily happen, but you could purport it to be so based on the pattern. But you probably don`t want to see that. Also, you assume that it needs to break 674 or the correction will lead to the formation of the right shoulder. Okay, say it does, but then when that pattern fails to realize its assumed conclusion and instead breaks out to the upside, you`ll say--oh that right shoulder was really just the tip of a bull flag with the once-thought head being the top of the pole. It is a bit like watching politics though, in that the outcome that you wish for skews your interpretation of what you are seeing and gives you conviction where little if none is founded. Technically AAPL has again poked her stern though the swarming threshold of parabolic and the sabers rattle without rest. Correction or continuation? Only your hairdresser knows for sure.

Message.Title: LG says started production of new screen, as Apple plans product launch
Message.Msg: Wed Aug 22, 2012 8:12pm EDT SEOUL (Reuters) - Flat-screen maker LG Display has started mass production of a new and thinner display, widely speculated to be for use in Apple Inc's next iPhone, and the display's production schedule remains in line with customers' product release plans, LG's chief executive said. "We just began mass production and we don't expect any disruption in supplies," Han Sang-beom, chief executive of LG Display, a panel supplier for Apple products, told reporters late on Wednesday. His comments were embargoed until early Thursday morning. Apple is planning a major product launch on September 12, stoking speculation that the world's most valuable technology company will announce the sale of its redesigned iPhone. Apple is equipping the next iPhone with a larger screen after Samsung Electronics unveiled its latest Galaxy smartphone with a 4.8-inch touch-screen. Sources have told Reuters that the panels for the new iPhone will be 4 inches corner to corner -- 30 percent bigger than current iPhones. The iPhone screens will also be thinner than previous versions with the use of so-called in-cell panels. The new technology embeds touch sensors into the liquid crystal display, eliminating the touch-screen layer found in current iPhones. Japan's Sharp Corp also said earlier this month it would start shipping screens destined for a new iPhone in August. (Reporting by Miyoung Kim; Editing by Edmund Klamann)

Topic.Title: If iphone5 and ipad mini are going to be huge why have apple earnings ests for next yr fallen last 30 days?

Message.Msg: APPLE's business is best described as event-centric -- with sales spiking during new product launches -- especially new iPhone launches -- because the iPhone is very profitable. This is why the EPS estimates fluctuate during what is referred to as a "Transition Quarter" (The Quarter in which a New iPhone is launched...when the numbers are not reflected in the entire quarter). It is rumored that the new iPhone 5 will launch just before the end of this Quarter. This Quarter (Ending Sept. 24th, 2012), APPLE's Management has guided EPS of $7.65 at the time of the previous Earnings Report. As of now, Wall Street's Consensus EPS estimate is $8.46 (10.6% higher than APPLE's Company Guidance). I believe APPLE will "beat" their own Company Guidance -- because they have a consistent tract record of doing just that. As for the Wall Street Consensus, I could care less -- as they have been WRONG on AAPL consistently. However, the correct guidance to follow has always been APPLE's own "Company Guidance". APPLE “BEATS” COMPANY GUIDANCE OF EPS CONSISTENTLY: APPLE "BEATS" their own Company Guidance consistently as follows: 2010 Q1 (Ending 12/31/10) Guidance = $4.80; Actual = $6.43;(Beat = 40.0%) 2011 Q2 (Ending 3/31/11) Guidance = $4.90; Actual = $6.40; (Beat = 30.6%) 2011 Q3 (Ending 6/31/11) Guidance = $5.07; Actual = $7.79; (Beat = 53.6%) 2011 Q4 (Ending 9/24/11) Guidance = $5.50; Actual = $7.05 (Beat = 28.2%) 2012 Q1 (Ending 12/31/11) Guidance = $9.30; Actual = $13.87 (Beat = 49.1%) 2012 Q2 (Ending 3/31/12) Guidance = $8.50; Actual = $12.30 (Beat = 44.7%) 2012 Q3 (Ending 6/30/12) Guidance = $8.68; Actual = $9.32 (Beat = 7.37%) Given: APPLE’s EPS Company Guidance is $7.65 for This Quarter (Fiscal Q4 Ending Sept. 24, 2012). If APPLE “beats” their Guidance by only 20% (Equating to an actual EPS of $9.18), then TTM EPS = $44.67… 15 PE = $670.05/sh.; 16 PE = $714.72/sh.; 17 PE = $759.39/sh.; 18 PE = $804.06/sh.; 19 PE = $848.73/sh.; 20 PE = $893.40/sh. If APPLE “beats” their Guidance by 30% (Equating to an actual EPS of $9.95), then TTM EPS = $45.44… 15 PE = $681.60/sh.; 16 PE = $727.04/sh.; 17 PE = $772.48/sh.; 18 PE = $817.92/sh.; 19 PE = $863.36/sh.; 20 PE = $908.80/sh. INVEST (And - REINVEST DIVIDENDS) in AAPL for the LONG-TERM !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
